es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential
Class Activity.ActivityWorkGroup

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.WorkGroup
      es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.Activity.ActivityWorkGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActivityWorkGroup, Describable, Identifiable, WorkGroup, Prioritizable, java.lang.Comparable<Activity.ActivityWorkGroup>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlowDrivenActivity.ActivityWorkGroup, TimeDrivenActivity.ActivityWorkGroup
Enclosing class:
Activity
public class Activity.ActivityWorkGroup
extends WorkGroup
implements ActivityWorkGroup, java.lang.Comparable<Activity.ActivityWorkGroup>

A set of resources needed for carrying out an activity. A workgroup (WG) consists on a set of (resource type, #needed resources) pairs, a condition which determines if the workgroup can be used or not, and the priority of the workgroup inside the activity.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

isFeasible

protected java.util.ArrayDeque<Resource> isFeasible(WorkItem wi)
Checks if there are enough resources to carry out an activity by using this workgroup. The "potential" available resources are booked by the element requesting the activity. If there are less available resources than needed resources for any resource type, the activity can not be carried out, and all the "books" are removed. Possible conflicts between resources inside the activity are solved by invoking a branch-and-bound resource distribution algorithm.

Parameters:
wi - Work Item trying to carry out the activity with this workgroup
Returns:
The set of resources which compound the solution. Null if there are not enough resources to carry out the activity by using this workgroup.

findSolution

protected boolean findSolution(java.util.ArrayDeque<Resource> solution,
                               int[] pos,
                               int[] ned,
                               WorkItem wi)
Makes a depth first search looking for a solution.

Parameters:
pos - Position to look for a solution [ResourceType, Resource]
ned - Resources needed
Returns:
True if a valid solution exists. False in other case.
